page.title: 04Ecology in the area
page.content: Hedgerows are cut by machine, and are composed mainly of hawthorn, hazel and elder, with brambles growing through. Stone field walls are found mostly around Scotton. Water birds, such as Snow, Barnacle and Canada Geese, are attracted to Farmire Fishiry and to the flooded gravel workings. Near Farnham there is a starling roost. Throstle Nest Farm has badger setts on its land. The rare Fly Orchid is to be found in Farnham (or Gibbet) Wood. The York and Ainsty Hunt comes across this land but does no damage. New estates of houses are built of material sympathetic to the older buildings and are not intrusive. See also page on Farnham Mires.
